website_summaries.verdict: For quickly hanging up a single bike at home, or affordably providing storage at the office, these vertical hangers offer a brilliant solution.
pros: A vertical wall hanger that holds a single bicycle
Holds all wheel sizes, and has a maximum weight of 40 lbs., allowing riders to store even sturdier bikes
An included tray keeps the wall free of tire marks
cons: Load on the front bike wheel is high, which isn’t ideal for road bikes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for our office cycling needs.
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy and were very easy to mount. We used a piece of 1x6 Poplar and fashioned our own steampunk style bar for the rear tire in lieu of using the stick on rear tire mount. But ulitimately they look and perform great in our office.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Annoyingly difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: This rack was easy to install, but the hook is so hooked, it's really tough to slide your bike onto it. It requires a lot of spinning to properly orient the bicycle, probably because the red padding slides down passed the tip of the hook. After using it a few months, the red padding is becoming shredded and it's increasingly difficult to use. All this maneuvering around the hook has also resulted in lots of scuffing on my wall. I purchased another model last month for a second bike with a straighter hook and it's way easier and more efficient- plus no wall scuffing. Now we fight over the new hook because this one is so annoying to use.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Good wall mount
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good wall mount, easy installation, holds bike well. My only complaint is the crappy adhesive strip on the lower tray and the fact that there isn't a pre-drilled hole on the lower tray. I have the rack installed on a naked stud and every time the rear wall hits the lower tray at an angle other than straight on, it pops the tray off. Finally drilled it out and screwed it to the stud. Much better.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon & Cacia

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and sturdy. I use these with mountain bikes as well ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and sturdy. I use these with mountain bikes as well as fat bikes. Do make sure you have a solid mounting surface. I used a 2x8 "cleat" on the wall and in my case ran a couple returns to the floor. I only did this because my walls are 100 year old clay tile and a toggle or Tapcon will not hold. Most folks should be able to simply attach the hooks directly into a stud or install a cleat similar to mine to the studs and then mount these. Well worth the effort - these freed up a bunch of space in my basement!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for reduced spaces
customer_reviews.text: Excellent choice for small places. It is very easy to install and once on the wall the bike hangs securely. I have this for my Cannondale in my apartment living room. If you ride constantly, may I suggest you to place it in an easy access room near your house/apartment/garage door. Also, Consider that this single bike rack does not include the tire tray for the rear tire.
customer_reviews.author: aeroDork

customer_reviews.title: Not for Mountain Bikes!
customer_reviews.text: Not for mountain bikes; simply does not fit (at least not mine). When the hook is locked around the rim, the wheel *does not* sit centered in the base. Instead the wheel is towards the top of the base, the result is that the tire rubs on the base's side loops. The wheel should be centered on the base. In the end I bent it to make it fit. Vice grips and a pipe wrench got it done.
customer_reviews.author: EBG

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work with my mountain bike
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get this to work with my mountain bike which has 2.2 inch tires. The design of the hook makes it almost impossible to use with bigger tires. I returned this product and instead recommend this one: "Dirza Bike Rack Garage Wall Mount Bike Hanger Storage System Vertical Bike Hook for Indoor Shed - Easily Hang/Detach - Heavy Duty Holds up to 65 lb with Screws Black"
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, protects spokes as well.
customer_reviews.text: The vertical mount went up with no issues. I just used a stud-finder, pencil, and drill. All-in-all it took about 10 minutes. Once you get the top part installed with the hook, rest the bike on it and note where the rear/bottom tire touches the wall. The bottom protector has a peel-n-stick pad to attach to the wall. Easy-peasy. I appreciate the hook that goes through the wheel and rests on the spokes is 'padded' which will help prevent the spokes from bending.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Kercheval

customer_reviews.title: Great way to reclaim garage floor space
customer_reviews.text: These hanger hooks are holding 5 different bikes in my garage. All are different sizes and weights. These are easy to install (tip: hang them an inch lower than you think you need them to make it easier to get the bike mounted) and look good on the wall. They seem sturdy and the addition of the tire cup allows storing bikes without wall scuffs if your garage is finished.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Sinor

customer_reviews.title: Works great, be sure to measure both height and width required before installing.
customer_reviews.text: This is great. My bike hangs well on it. When installing, be sure to measure the width in addition to the height needed. I used this for 2 bikes, the first bike was too close to the other wall (corner install) which causes the handle bars to rest on the other wall. Don't repeat my dumb mistake - measure fully first. Does NOT work on drywall unless you have the commercial graded snap toggles. I used Toggler Snaptoggle Toggle Bolt and Drywall Molly (Pack of 4) (ordered on Amazon) and it worked great on my drywall, but note it requires big holes in the drywall to install.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: I'm a weak girl who can't lift
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this item. It's larger than it looks and is very sturdy, but I am a single, tiny female who has no upper body strength and owns a heavy mountain bike. I physically can't lift my bike steady enough to reach the hook, and my tires are a little too fat to get inside the hook on the first try. You can see my struggles on the white wall near the hook where my tires have smudged all over the place. Its awful. I'm so upset this didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: This Girl’s Got It!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Took me a minute to install b/c confidence ;), I used a Hillman POP-Toggle 60lbs to be sure into wall board as I wanted to avoid metal studs. (Bike is only 14lbs). Then I used my hairdryer to quickly remove the double sided tape from the tire tray and replace it with a Command Strip to make future removal simple and easy.
customer_reviews.author: HippieFairie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect apartment or garage choice
customer_reviews.text: How easy is this? If you can screw into studs or use toggle bolts, this is the easiest and cheapest bike storage solution I have been able to find. Plastic guard for lower tire (optional) for inside use. Also options for thicker tires, so suggest checking details on which model you are buying. I only store bike in apartment during snow and ice season, so don't have a permanent place but this fits into a corner spot.
customer_reviews.author: tspia

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't trust this to actually store my 29" MTB with its wheel off of the ground, supporting the entire bike's weight, even with mounting into a stud. It just felt a bit sketchy to do so. With the rear wheel on the ground, it holds the bike perfectly though.
customer_reviews.author: Johann D

customer_reviews.title: Works well with non-conventional installation
customer_reviews.text: I had asked if it could be installed as shown in my pics because of space constraints and after having received multiple answers as yes and no, I decided to just give it a shot Took a bit of trial and error to get the height right so the back tire would rest on the actual garage floor, but it seems fairly sturdy and stable Since it’s in the corner it’s in a low foot traffic area so I wasn’t as concerned about the stability as the likelihood of anyone bumping into it is low
customer_reviews.author: pinkoos

customer_reviews.title: Really great product
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product a lot. It is a great idea, and the sturdiness of the hook is just what we needed. However, it didn't work for us as well as we hoped for. Having the bikes hang off the wall took up a lot of space in this format. They really stick out further than we anticipated. This is by no means the fault of the product. It just didn't work for our area. Would recommend measuring your bike and how far it will stick out from the wall before you purchase, but this is a great product for those that have the space.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy hook bracket, cheap plastic rear tire tray. Excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The hook bracket is sturdy and seems well made. The tire tray is just clear plastic and attaches with the attached sticky tape. I would have preferred metal and screws for the rear tire tray, but for the price this is a great product. I mounted two sets by first attaching pine boards horizontally to the wall studs using lag screws. Wall studs are usually spaced 16 inches apart (center to center), which is too close for most bikes. Mounting on horizontal boards allowed me to space the hooks about 20 inches apart so that the handlebars aren't banging into each other.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clemans

customer_reviews.title: Nice build but install is hit or miss.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. Holds bikes much better than I expected. Thick or wide tires above 2.5 are a bit tough to get in but really secure once they're inside. The manual is extremely vague, basically amounting to "line it up perfectly and screw in" but offers no advice on how to line it up. Otherwise, well built and satisfying to use. Holds my 27.5 inch full sus and my 650b gravel bikes with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Largent

customer_reviews.title: Was skeptical at first as it doesn't look like it will take the fattest of fat tires but ...
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical at first as it doesn't look like it will take the fattest of fat tires but sure enough I'm hanging my Fatboy with it's 4.6" ground controls just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rob C.

customer_reviews.title: Works with heavier ebikes, if mounted at the correct height.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well with my 26" mountain bike and my 700x40 mountain bike. My situation was a bit different as these are ebikes and are well over the 40 pound limit. So I made sure to have the rear wheel resting on the floor while hanging the bike. Mounting into the studs was easy enough with a pilot hole. Getting my bikes into the hanger is no problem once you get used to how the tire slips in. Not sure how I would do it with the back wheel, so I would advise front wheel only. I would buy again if ever needed.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Page

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great price.
customer_reviews.text: These bike holders are small and elegant and easy to use. We used a stud finder and placed two side by side and they work very well. The command strip on the bottom wheel holder is not sturdy, and they do not provide screws for that part, but there is a screw-shaped location for you to screw it into the wall for extra support. Good price for a sturdy product that makes my apartment feel bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Kenz

customer_reviews.title: Great Design
customer_reviews.text: It's all about how you install it. If you're luck enough to find studs in your wall, get a little bit longer screws and attach it there. I used a 1X6X5' board (sanded and stained) to attach to the wall in 5 places, then attached this mount to the board. Lower plastic guide sticks pretty well, but I still screwed it down. Very sturdy, and looks pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: filmyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: A decent hanger solution
customer_reviews.text: This is a quick and easy way to install some bike storage on a wood-stud or wood-stud wall. It was very easy to determine where to put it, and install it. The only concern I have is that this might put undue stress on a spoke/nipple if the wheel isn't in the hook in the right position. I haven't had any issues yet, but I always worry about that on hangers like this.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Bergus

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Space Saver and Looks Great
customer_reviews.text: Great Space Saver. Organized my garage and Installed two of these. What an awesome space saver and looks great. Easy to install in minutes. Like others have mentioned, you will need to find the stud to secure it properly. I hung my bikes close but offset the height so they don't touch. Turned out nice. Note: I have 50mm Zipp Carbon Wheels on my Trek, I am confident it will not damage them. Make sure it does not touch the spokes. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Astrid

customer_reviews.title: FAT TIRE Bike Hanger!
customer_reviews.text: Great FAT TIRE Bike Hanger, currently not available in Local Stores or Bike Shops. Easy to install, ideal for space saving...used for Trike, as well!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Really Like! Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a great price! I currently have two of my bikes hanging on these hooks, and I am very happy with them! We have them hanging on a wall inside our home, and they are very secure and easy to use. Installation is pretty easy and works best if you have a drill. This is a great price for this item. In store they typically are double to price and they do not include the clear tray. The clear tray is really nice, because it protects your walls from dirt and scuff marks from your front tire!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Installed this bike holder in minutes and it works perfectly. Heavy duty build. Written literature shows the weight capacity at 40lbs. My application is a tight fit corner and it worked great, freeing up some storage space. It worked so well to free up space I can store two bikes in the same area, so I’m going to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hodgson

customer_reviews.title: Must mount to wall stud.
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews of bike racks this one looked to be the most sturdy. It lived up to my expectations and holds my fat tire bike securely to the wall. Due to the nature of how this rack works it's imperative to mount it to a wall stud. Using a drywall anchor will most likely fail over time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So good I ordered a second one!
customer_reviews.text: As the headline says i ordered this to hang my Giant contender 58 and it worked beautifully. The gray finish isn't ostentatious and doesn't look out of place inside the house. Worked so well I ordered a second one to hang my wife's bike. Great product, a really sturdy build, simple to install.
customer_reviews.author: Grimrivet

customer_reviews.title: Screws too short
customer_reviews.text: This is going to be a great product. The hook/hangar itself is sturdy and well built and wlil do great. But the screws are just too short to get through dry wall and sink deep into the stud. If the screws were an inch longer, I would give this 5 STARS. But if I left I hung a bike on the hook with the screws that came with it, it would rip out of the wall in a matter of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Keller

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastically...
customer_reviews.text: This works exactly as described. Fairly easy to install, although I would not recommend using drywall anchors. I personally drilled straight into a stud. The plastic tray is fairly sturdy and thick. the tray did not have holes drilled into it, I drilled them myself. All in all if installed properly these work fantastically.
customer_reviews.author: CristianG

customer_reviews.title: Hooks are great, but the screws are too short
customer_reviews.text: These hooks work really well and look nice, but the screws that came with it were too short. The wall in our garage where I hung these has really thick drywall, so even though it was on a stud, the screw wasn't long enough to really get a good grip into the wood, and the hook and bike fell off the wall after a few days. After that, I reinstalled them with longer screws and have had no problems since. I do recommend these, just use caution and replace with longer screws if needed.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike rack
customer_reviews.text: This bike rack is awesome. The fat bike one is honestly better than the original in my opinion. They are super easy to hang but the fat bike one is easier to get your bike on and I prefer the galvanized look. Perfect for hanging bikes and getting them out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Good, not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bikes seem to hang a little leaning to one side. But otherwise, works well. Can be somewhat of a pain to unhook and get off the wall. Ignore reviews that say the included screws are not adequate. As long as its in a stud they are very sufficient. I made the mistake of believing these suggestions and drilled in screws I thought would be better (longer and thicker) and they did not quite fit the plate. I used the included screws for the rest of my hangers and they worked much better.
customer_reviews.author: Occasional reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really sure why/how anyone has a problem with this design. It's not hard to get the bike on and off, just take your time and actually look at the wheel as you pull it off. Simple design and a great solution for my bike storage need in a small Baltimore rowhouse.
customer_reviews.author: TheDominoKid

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: These are waste of money, I stalled them as instructed but wouldn’t hold the bike, the hook where the wheel goes I feel like it would end up ruining my wheel, I returned both
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Good product, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Good product ,easy to install. My only complaint is the rubber 'boot' on the hook is constantly sliding off when you pull your bikes off the hook. You can slide it back easily, but it's a minor nuisance that would prefer to not worry about. The rubber boot is also prone to tearing if you are not careful. One other tip, measure carefully, keeping in mind the hook/bike hangs much lower than it seems so be sure to compensate for that.
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works well with balloon tires on cruiser bike.
customer_reviews.text: Mostly upsides and happy. The red covering is a length of plastic sleeve. It may or may not last, but should be relatively easy to replace if/when it gets chewed up. Clear wall protector for bottom tire is discreet but seems like it could be a deeper trough; doesn't hold tire securely against bumps. Also, self-adhesive will likely to more damage to wall finish on removal; suggest using short screws -- there's not a lot of stress on the part.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shyloski

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This bike walk stand is great however, the lower part of it doesn’t come with screws. And the whole thing should be shipped with everything one needs to install it. The lower part has a sticker instead of screws. All in all it is a great buy and I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Edgaba

customer_reviews.title: Clean and Minimal - multiple work great when staggered in a row.
customer_reviews.text: I installed four of these next to each other. I ended up a pacing them 16 inches apart and staggered them vertically, also by 16 inches. This allowed a more compact install. All in all the trickiest part for me was finding the studs, and hence the 16” on center spacing (I had planned on a 13” spacing initially) Admittedly it’s been only 48 hours; but I’m currently a very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: FM SFO

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea, hard to implement
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea, difficult to use. Effort needed to get bikes up into the needed position can be tedious. You need room. After two days, kids don't use because it is too difficult. Can't have anything under them. Seems to put a lot of pressure on spokes if not placed perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: BWEST

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Once I got the right drill bit for the butterfly wall bolts (bought separately), this went in SO easy! It looks great amd my bike is up and out of my floor space. Per other reviews, I put mine straight into dry wall without a stud, but used the butterfly bolts. I'm 5'3 and did it all by myself no problem.
customer_reviews.author: AA09

customer_reviews.title: Works for light bikes only. 20lbs max
customer_reviews.text: Must be screwed into wall studs, do not use hollow wall bolts. I tore two huge holes in the wall when 65lbs rated hollow wall bolts tore out. 20lb bike max or the mount flexes alot.
customer_reviews.author: IAN

customer_reviews.title: BUY BIGGER SCREWS - FIND A STUD
customer_reviews.text: Works great though I did buy bigger screws and made sure to anchor in a stud. Keep in mind, mine is installed in my garage in my house as opposed to an apartment scenario. One caution for the concerned bike owner, when hanging your bike make sure you align the wheel in a manner that does not lean on a spoke. Not a design issue, there is no means for the manufacturer to account for this. Great space saver and really easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: COME ON MAN!!

customer_reviews.title: Hang 'em high
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I bought after the bike shop quit carrying them. You can do the same thing with a wall/ceiling hanger hook from a hardware store for a little cheaper, but these are a really nice design and they work well. I put my bike high enough in the garage to still fit things beneath it in the off season. Great space saver and I don't have to worry about the bike getting knocked over. Be sure to anchor it to something sturdy like a wall stud, most sheetrock anchors would be a little doubtful for the weight of a bike.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 of these
customer_reviews.text: Great space saver and it looks cool with our bikes mounted on the wall. Definitly install it into a stud in the wall. Installation is a 2 person job cause you need to measure where to place the pieces based on your bike. Only complaint is the rubber guard on the top hook started falling apart after a couple years, but my husband also commutes to work by bike so he is constantly take the bike off/on.
customer_reviews.author: Simone

customer_reviews.title: Gets your 2 wheeler up and out the way
customer_reviews.text: Picked up two of these to hang our road bikes in our garage. They were family easy to install and there is an included piece that stops your rear wheel from tarnishing your wall. Overall a high quality piece that I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: QikPass

customer_reviews.title: A must have for the family bikes!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! But I recommend using longer/stronger nails than the ones included just to be more safe. Mount to studs or concrete, do not mount just to dry wall. Works with with regular mountain bike tire, 700c, etc. Does not work that well with the super fat tires, doable but do not recommend Do note that the red rubber cover may slowly slip off, but easy to nudge it back into place. Bought 3!
customer_reviews.author: R. Lam

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bike hooks
customer_reviews.text: These hooks are sturdy and hold our bikes well. The picture on Amazon showed a red coating on the hook, but they arrived in gray which look better how we’re using them. I had a friend install them and it didn’t take him much time to complete. (Note: the pictures are uploading sideways)
customer_reviews.author: Carole R.

customer_reviews.title: More rugged than expected
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the quality of this product. Installed this in just a few minutes and created some additional space in my garage as well as having a safe space for my road bike.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: A cure for your bicycle hangups!
customer_reviews.text: A cure for your bicycle hangups! This is a simple solution for getting your bike off the garage floor. It's simple to install and it actually is attractively designed -- not a deal maker, but nice. Just raise the front wheel into the hook and the weight of the bike holds it firmly on the wall. But wait, there's more: the deal includes a device that holds the bottom wheel in place, protecting your wall from dirty tire marks plus holding the bike in position. One possible negative... there might be concern for a shorter person about lifting the bike and placing the wheel above their head.
customer_reviews.author: Jayress

customer_reviews.title: Not enough room for my fat bike tire.
customer_reviews.text: Not enough room for my fat bike tire. I have a 4.8" tire. Didn't seem close really.
customer_reviews.author: B. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: The bike was easy to fit and it hangs well
customer_reviews.text: The product is well-built. The direction of the hook does not seem to be selectable when ordering. The photos show it as being right-hooked; my product was left-hooked (incidentally I preferred it that way, though I don't think it matters). When installing, I followed the included instructions - I found that pre-drilling the screw holes helped. The bike was easy to fit and it hangs well. I don't have any unusual sized MTB tires, so I've had no issues on that front.
customer_reviews.author: DeMinimus

customer_reviews.title: Great item would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: The wall mount is great the only items missing in my opinion are, 2 flat washer spacers. They really secure in place. Other than that, very easy to install all you need is stud sensor, drill gun and drill bit and your good to go.
customer_reviews.author: JesusSaves

customer_reviews.title: Solid, dependable mount
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as expected. Hangs a ~50lb electric fat bike quite well. It gets used almost daily, and is holding up quite well. Needed some heavy-heavy-duty concrete anchors, but am completely satisfied with the purchase. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: random nerd#29410

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my space
customer_reviews.text: String, simple, economical solution for storing a bike. I installed two on a plaster and brick wall using solid wall anchors. Very important to get anchor placement as accurate as possible as the back of the metal bracket is unforgiving when screwing in.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn G

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack, Crappy Hardware
customer_reviews.text: Fit's my Krampus tire perfectly but do NOT use the included hardware. Fat bikes are heavy and they will rip this thing off the wall if you're not using butterfly bolts or going into a stud as it did at 3am scaring the crap out of me!
customer_reviews.author: KXMHM

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected we have 10 bikes but two we keep next to the door. Previous system was a rubbermaid fast track to span the studs in the wall and plexiglass drilled into the dry wall to protect against damage to the wall from wet tires. This works very well and the included tire tray provides a more aesthetically pleasing form of wall protection than a sheet of lexan.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, sturdy build
customer_reviews.text: Really good build quality and i liked how it includes a pad for the rear wheel. Installation was easy. The instruction said to mount it 12 inches higher which I shouldn't have listened to. It ended up higher than I wanted but I didn't want to bother with patching.
customer_reviews.author: EvilTechie

customer_reviews.title: Neat unit, but cheap/broken mounting screws
customer_reviews.text: The design is innovative and sleek, but the screws on both of our units sheared off within a week. We followed all mounting instructions, drilled pilot holes before screwing them in, etc. The only conclusion we could come to was that the included screws were bad. They hold up our bikes very well, once we replaced the included screws with higher-quality ones. This may sound like a minor quibble to casual users, but if you own a bike that costs $1000 or more, you don't want it crashing down from the mount when you least expect it- and all because the manufacturer wanted to save on a 10-cent part.
customer_reviews.author: Bam Bam

customer_reviews.title: Work well for periodic use
customer_reviews.text: We have two bikes we rarely use, and can't leave them outside because we're in an apartment. These allow us to hang them on our wall fairly out of the way. They wobble a bit when you bump in to them, and because we don't take them down often, I can't speak for frequent use, but for the price, they've worked out well. Keep in mind your bikes will stick straight off the wall, so consider their height to see if you have room. (Picture four feet of unusable space on the spot you hang them). I staggered our two bikes vertically though, which compressed the horizontal space pretty well. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Laxoman

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother ... buy the cheaper plain black racks over these
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of these, and a couple of the plain black wall mounts that are less than half the price (different brand). I wish I'd just bought the cheap ones. I echo the reviews here complaining about how hard it is to mount the bike give the shape/size of the hook. My son only has 24" tires so I figured it would not be so bad for his bike ... stupid me for not listening better to others.
customer_reviews.author: Alistair D. Young

customer_reviews.title: Cleanest Indoor Bike Hook Option
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to hang a Transition Patrol, with ENVE M60 Forty HV rims. I was nervous this hook wouldn't have the depth to handle the fairly deep dish of the rims, but it's working great. I personally think this is the cleanest and best way to hang a bike in your house. Buy this, don't skimp and buy those dumb hooks from the hardware store. If you have a nice bike, hang it on a nice hook. :)
customer_reviews.author: Nick Fish

customer_reviews.title: Nice and solid material used.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hang my bike at oversea work place where I do not have a garage as my US home. This product looks and feels very solid and seems it will last forever. I am very satisfied with this purchase. Although the rear wheel catch tray is plastic. But, it is a thick, hard, clear piece that I do not think it will break. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Scott YehTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy easy to install and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and use. We used 4 of them on our garage and it works wonderfully. We have been using them for about 3 months now and it is working great. I would strongly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: PDC

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a good price
customer_reviews.text: was easy to install, but instructions could have been clearer. I did not know what to interpret of the “add 12 inches to find top screw hole” part. Was that referring to the correct height when both wheels are on the wall and the back wheel is touching the ground? For me, the correct height of the top screw was wherever the front wheel was on the wall, plus 6 centimeters. Overall, its a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel H.

customer_reviews.title: Simple & sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Seems great so far! Very sturdy; easy to install by yourself. Finding the stud and figuring out how high I wanted to hang it took more time than actually mounting it on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Great bicycle holder
customer_reviews.text: This bicycle holder is easy to install and very easy to put your bike up onto. I would recommend installing a board behind it if your bike is heavy that spans across two studs so that you are distributing the weight of the bike. Also I love the bottom tire holder as it keeps it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan C.

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Sleek & Stylish
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect solution for bike storage in our small condo. We purchased an 8in x 3/4in piece of pine, then stained and polyurethaned. The board is secured into 5 studs, and the hooks are spaced out at 27in each. With this spacing, it ensured that the handlebars won't overlap. The black hooks created a nice look and we utilized the screws that were provided in the packaging. After weeks of researching different storage methods, we couldn't be happier with how this setup worked out.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Matoian

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: This hook is great. I live in a small house and utilizing vertical space is the secret to my success. I bought two of these and hung up one 6 inches above the other so the handle bars don't hit each other. Make sure to hang them on studs. I wouldn't trust anything else. As a not very strong woman I like that I don't have to lift the bike up very much. It's only a little awkward to turn the wheel and get it in the hook while holding it.
customer_reviews.author: Fiora

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack
customer_reviews.text: I used to have my bike hanging from a hoist in the garage, but I was always worried about banging it if I lifted anything up. This wall rack is great. I use it with a 29" mountain bike. This is the fat tire version of the rack and it's very easy to get the tire for my mountain bike in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Not terrible..
customer_reviews.text: The hook only works if we put the bike in at a certain angle. Otherwise the bike's rim is to big and wont go in. Also, the piece for the bottom tire has an adhesive rather than a screw to mount on the wall. It does not stay stuck to the wall for more than 5 seconds. Ended up throwing it away.... it was useless.
customer_reviews.author: eric bartholomeu

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but difficult to get on
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my road bike and my son's mountain bike. My road bike fits fine, but my son's mountain bike barely fits on the hook, and is very difficult to put up. Unfortunately, my son can't do it by himself. If your wheel and tire are more than 2.5", you may have trouble fitting it between the hook and the wall. There really aren't any directions for hanging your bike, and I found the process unintuitive. I found that starting with the bike's front wheel parallel to the floor and then turning it behind the hook works much better than trying to slide the bike along the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Functional and aesthetically pleasing
customer_reviews.text: These are great! My boyfriend and I are using them to hang our collectors bikes in our living room and we love them because they fit with the look of our modern upscale apartment. They are discreet when the bikes are hung and very sturdy. They were also very easy to mount.
customer_reviews.author: Cassidy S.

customer_reviews.title: Wall Mount Bike Rack
customer_reviews.text: This is a very simple and elegant way to store you bikes off of the ground to save space. I put two of these side by side for our hybrid 700 series bicycles. Mounted one a little lower so the handlebars would clear each other. Very well made and sturdy especially for its reasonable price. Screwed directly into wall studs sixteen inches apart.
customer_reviews.author: Professor H

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Ordered two of these and had them ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Ordered two of these and had them installed and bikes hanging it about 15 minutes. One was a 29er MB and the fit is snug with wider tires but it works and no concern with damage to the wheel. The directions are a little vague so I simply marked where I wanted the front tire to sit in the wall (which is wear the tire will sit on the bracket once installed). From there it's pretty easy if your even remotely handy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased. Oh
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised. Note, you're hanging up a bicycle on the wall. Make sure you mount it into a stud. We picked one up during the Prime Day garage sale to support our garage clean up efforts a little bit. Very pleased. Oh, be mindful of the orientation of the bike with the wall. It will look like the picture, with the bike appearing to be "riding up" the wall. You can't use it to hold the bike flush against the wall. Be sure you have an appropriately shaped and clear space for it. Ours was next to the central AC air handler.
customer_reviews.author: JTC

customer_reviews.title: Drama Free Storage
customer_reviews.text: I use these for a track bike with a fixed gear. This is a very lightweight bike, and so there's not a lot involved with getting it into and out of the front wheel 'hook.' I can see if I had a heavier bike with a wider tire, this could be a problem... but in my case it isn't. Using a cordless drill for the hardware necessitates adjusting the clutch so you don't over tighten the screws... especially on the plastic lower wheel plate. Other than that and the wall placement, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: snailmartyr

customer_reviews.title: A bike hook that works!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and will not scratch your bike or bend your wheels. It allows for space saving storage and easy of mounting and dismounting your bikes. I’ve since purchased 3 of these for friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: private

customer_reviews.title: Its a bike hook. It works.
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly useful. I live in an apartment and was able to install these on the wall of a balcony closet, made it way easier to store our bikes outside and out of sight. I didn't really find use for the plastic mount that is meant to help hold the second tire in place, the single metal hook was sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Took about 5min to setup just like the video. However, there is some leveling to note or otherwise the bike will not rest completely perpendicular. I have a 58cm Specialized roadbike hanging on it now. For about $10, it's the best deal for a really simple solution.
customer_reviews.author: Dudemanken

customer_reviews.title: Modification needed for big tires...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so my daughter could put up her mountain bike without having to lift it to the ceiling to hang it up. After the install, she will not be able to hook this either. It says all tire sizes will fit. Well, she has a 26x 2.10 tire and it is hard to get through the side opening of the hook. I tried my dual wall Bontranger 29x 2.0 and it is hard to get through as well. Since I own them, I plan to cut some of the end of the hook to open it up some to get our big tires in there.
customer_reviews.author: wyleone

customer_reviews.title: I have a FUJI bike with some carbon fiber components that hangs easily in my apartment
customer_reviews.text: It's meant for a bike, so don't hang anything else on it. I have a FUJI bike with some carbon fiber components that hangs easily in my apartment, but I also hung an aluminum bike with no problem. I like the second little plastic piece it comes with to rest your back tire on, so you don't scuff your wall. Just find a stud on your wall, and drill this sucker in with the screws provided. Saves spaces and keeps my (relatively) expensive road bike safe. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: steverok87

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to put up.  4" tire fits easily, 5" may be a bit snug.
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked like a champ assuming you can get into the wall joists. Have a electronic stud finder before you start and its up on the wall in 5 minutes or less after you determine the high of the mount and where the stud is located.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... write a review - but this product is so good I had to do it
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write a review - but this product is so good I had to do it. I mounted these on the wall of my garage 16" apart (basically consecutive studs) and was able to hang my bikes up and down alternatively without any issues. I have two roadies, two wide bar mountain bikes and one vintage schwinn - plenty of room. great product and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Asok Patnaik

customer_reviews.title: STURD-EE!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT product! sturdy construction. need anchor hardware if mounting in garage. Needs care removing the wheel between the spokes. Dont hang it too high as it might be difficult to remove the bike. Great choice!
customer_reviews.author: P Rivo

customer_reviews.title: Kids 24" bike is impossible to hook
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 of these to put on studs in the shed. Had no problem installing, and 3 bikes fit tightly next to each other when they hang, but in order to remove one you have to take all three off since you can't put them on the hook (or take them off) without tilting them close to the wall. Surprisingly, my daughter's 24" cruiser bike is the hardest to put on. After on/off just a couple of times, the red rubber on the hook started to tear. Can't return them anymore since the packaging is gone, but won't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Rubber wears quickly
customer_reviews.text: The rubber protective sleeve wears down quickly. This is the part of the hook support that protects the wheel rim from scratches. A couple of my bikes have painted black rims. The general design is good, but I knocked off two stars for the sleeve.
customer_reviews.author: cnsmr

customer_reviews.title: Needed to get better hardware to hang 2 sets on the wall
customer_reviews.text: Needed to get better hardware to hang 2 sets on the wall, had to be sure it was a stud with what I was given. The hook sits a bit high on my 26" wheels but the red rubber is soft on the rim - no scratches. Tape on the wheel plate was flimsy, had to replace that as well. If you have backup hardware etc to mount it it's great but the hardware included is inadequate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mount, easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Great and easy to set up. I had it up in about 5 minutes and the bike was hanging in 30seconds after that! Really like that you can put it just about anywhere. Helps clear up some room on the floor in the garage/ makes the space look tidier.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: High quality, durable, and reasonably stylish
customer_reviews.text: I have been using five of these for years now and have yet to have a failure of any sorts. Over time, the red rubber on the front wheel holder will start to show some wear, but not surprising after nearly weekly use. Can't go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: DeDub

customer_reviews.title: It does the job. Not the best, but it works!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to get my bikes out of the front hallway. I've taken my bike off and put it back on about 5-10 times. The clear part that holds the bottom tire in place fell off. The adhesive isn't very sticky. The red rubber also tore off from the tire moving. It still does the job. It's a good product for the price. I replaced the adhesive with a stronger tape from a local hardware store. Overall, it's good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi K.

customer_reviews.title: Well Made - Works Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I'm so impressed by the small footprint, heavy duty construction, and appearance. What a brilliant idea for hanging your bike. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: NiksterD

customer_reviews.title: Durable Frame and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: But the rubber part that holds the bike wheel cracks quickly leaving the metal bar hold the wheel. This could scratch the wheel as it’s metal to metal
customer_reviews.author: Donald P. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Storage Option
customer_reviews.text: Great for a small apartment, was happy to receive one in the grey color vs. the red available in most stores. Installation was easy, use a magnet to locate a stud on the wall and drill it in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth the time to send it back.
customer_reviews.text: Kinda pointless in my application, really. I thought I'd be able to get my bike out of the way in my garage/workshop, but it really doesn't take up that much less room and it's harder to move if it is in the way. I suppose if I still had my apartment in San Francisco I could hang my bike in a place that would otherwise be wasted space. Not real impressed. Also I'm worried that if I leave it hanging with one of the spokes resting on the hook, that it'll bend the spoke or tweak it out of tune.
customer_reviews.author: Tugboat

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: I installed a second board to mount it on, since I wanted to hang it where there wasn't a stud. But otherwise, I'm very happy - it works perfectly and keeps my bike out of the way in my small apartment.
customer_reviews.author: sariahjane

customer_reviews.title: Stirdy Bike Hanger
customer_reviews.text: Great bike hanger. Minus 1 star because it is a bit tough to get thicker 27.5 tires on a mountain bike to just slide in easily compared to road bikes or others. Maybe like 5 more centimeters of loop on the hook and this would be a great hanger for all size tires. Maybe even 29ers. I like the extra long metal portion so the tire sits on it and doesn't scuff your wall.
customer_reviews.author: acousticmany

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my 4.5" wide fat tire. Very happy with it. The picture showed red rubber, but I received black rubber (which I'm happy with! I wanted black so that worked out well for me.)
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: way cooler than I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: love it. It works perfectly and gets the stupid bikes of the floor in the back porch. had to get new screws. but the products itself is high quality and works perfectly. It one of my favorite surprise purchases of the year.

product_meta.title: Delta Cycle Leonardo Da Vinci Single Bike Storage Rack Hook Hanger for Vertical Indoor Garage
feature_bullets: Space saving and quick storage: Hang any bike bicycle vertically in seconds, color may vary
Simple installation: No assembly required, easy installation to wall.
Includes tray: includes da Vinci wall tray to keep your surfaces clean and protected
Rubber sleeves protect bike from scratches
Versatile and heavy duty: accommodates any wheel size; Maximum load of 40 pounds
Modern design: storage hooks looks good on the wall without bike
All storage areas: Great for apartments with limited space. Garages, storage rooms, sheds, any room in the house or retail applications.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
